children.name: Livestock
children.para: Increased productivity and access to markets in the agriculture and Livestock sectors. Expected Outcomes: 1)Increase in the yield of key crops in target areas 2)Increase in the productivity of target Livestock species 3)Increase in access to agriculture assets or services 4)Increased access to markets as measured by price premia and higher sales in target value chains. Indicator 1.1: Increased yields (maize, sorghum, cassava) in target areas Baseline (2015): Cassava: 8t/ha ; Maize: 1.5 t/ha ; Sorghum : 1t/ha Target by 2021 Cassava: 24t/ha ; Maize: 4 t/ha ; Sorghum : 3t/ha o/w in northern regions Baseline (2015): Maize: 1.5 t/ha ; Sorghum : 1t/ha Target by 2021: Maize: 4 t/ha; Sorghum: 2t/ha Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project Indicator 1.2: Increased productivity of targeted Livestock species by farmers and pastoralists beneficiaries in target areas Ruminants (mortality rate): Baseline (2016): 20% Target by 2019: 12% Broiler (Kg of live weight per m2 per year): Baseline (2016): 60 Target by 2019: 90 Source: Livestock Development Project Indicator 1.3: Farmers reached with agriculture assets or services Baseline AIMDB (2015): 0 Target by 2020: 120,000 o/w women: 70 percent Baseline Livestock Development Project: 0 Target by 2022: 140,000 o/w female: 20,000 o/w youth: 20,000 Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project; Livestock Development Project Indicator 1.4: Price premium of produce sold by beneficiary farmers in targeted value chains (increase in percentage relative to the 2015 price baseline) Sorghum: +20 percent Maize: +15 percent Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project Indicator 1.5 Incremental sales in targeted value chains (average of all value chains) Baseline (2016): value of sales Target by 2021: +20 percent in value of sales Source: Livestock Development Project

children.name: Education and Gender

Indicator 3.1: Primary completion rate, overall and by ZEP and Gender Overall: Baseline (2014): 74% Target by 2021: 77% Education Priority Zones (ZEPs (*), including northern regions): Baseline (2014): 64% Target by 2021: 70% Girls: Baseline (2014): 70% Target by 2021: 75% Source: Administrative Data (*) Include the Far North, North, Adamawa, East, certain pockets of low levels of school participation in the largest cities, and their border regions. children.name: Health
children.para:
Increased productivity and access to markets in the agriculture and livestock sectors. Expected Outcomes:
1)Increase in the yield of key crops in target areas
2)Increase in the productivity of target livestock species
3)Increase in access to agriculture assets or services
4)Increased access to markets as measured by price premia and higher sales in target value chains. Indicator 1.1:
Increased yields (maize, sorghum, cassava) in target areas
Baseline (2015): Cassava: 8t/ha ; Maize: 1.5 t/ha ; Sorghum : 1t/ha
Target by 2021
Cassava: 24t/ha ; Maize: 4 t/ha ; Sorghum : 3t/ha
o/w in northern regions
Baseline (2015): Maize: 1.5 t/ha ; Sorghum : 1t/ha
Target by 2021: Maize: 4 t/ha; Sorghum: 2t/ha
Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project
Indicator 1.2:
Increased productivity of targeted livestock species by farmers and
pastoralists beneficiaries in target areas
Ruminants (mortality rate):
Baseline (2016): 20%
Target by 2019: 12%
Broiler (Kg of live weight per m2 per year):
Baseline (2016): 60
Target by 2019: 90
Source: Livestock Development Project
Indicator 1.3:
Farmers reached with agriculture assets or services
Baseline AIMDB (2015): 0
Target by 2020: 120,000
o/w women: 70 percent
Baseline Livestock Development Project: 0
Target by 2022: 140,000
o/w female: 20,000
o/w youth: 20,000
Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project;
Livestock Development Project
Indicator 1.4:
Price premium of produce sold by beneficiary farmers in targeted
value chains (increase in percentage relative to the 2015 price
baseline)
Sorghum: +20 percent
Maize: +15 percent
Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project
Indicator 1.5
Incremental sales in targeted value chains (average of all value
chains)
Baseline (2016): value of sales
Target by 2021: +20 percent in value of sales
Source: Livestock Development Project

Indicator 5.1: Additional people provided with access to drainage Baseline (2016): 0 Target by 2021: 500,000 Source: Inclusive Cities Project Indicator 5.2: People provided with access to improved sanitation facilities a) in target rural areas: Baseline (2011): 0 Target by 2017: 25,000 Source: Sanitation Project b) in target urban areas: Baseline (2011): 0 Target by 2017: 85,500 Source: Sanitation Project Indicator 5.3: Roads rehabilitated a) Km of roads rehabilitated in rural areas Baseline (2014): 0 Target by 2022: 1,270 Source: Agriculture Investment and Market Development Project, Community Development Program Support Project Phase III b) Additional people provided with access to all-season roads Baseline (2017): 0 Target by 2022: 660,000 Source: Inclusive Cities Project c) Additional km of national roads rehabilitated Baseline (2016): 0 Target by 2022: 330 km Source: CEMAC Transit and Transport Facilitation Project, Multimodal Transport Project, Transport Sector Development Project Indicator 5.4: Access to electricity Baseline (2016): 69 percent (o/w northern regions: 47 percent) Target by 2021: 88 percent (o/w northern regions: 75 percent) Source: Access to Electricity in Northern Regions Project

children.name: City Systems
children.para:
Improved efficiency of public expenditure and service delivery. 1)Increase in the share of central public investment derived from Local Development Plans
2)Increase in the number of local councils publishing annual accounts
3)Increase in execution rates of local councils investment budgets
4)Improved performance in health PBF districts
5)Improved performance in PBF schools. Indicator 10.1:
Local plans
Share of decentralized Public Investment Budget projects derived
from Local Development Plans (percentage)
Baseline (2016): 65 percent
Target by March 2020: 77 percent
Source: Community Development Program Support Project Phase III
Indicator 10.2:
Local accounts
Percent of local councils producing annual accounts on SIM_BA software
Baseline (2014): 8 percent
Target by March 2020: 50 percent
Source: Community Development Program Support Project Phase III
Indicator 10.3:
Execution rates
Share of public investment budgets executed (ordonnanc) in selected
sectors by year end (December 31st)
Baseline (2015): 50%
Target by FY21: 80%
Source: Budget Department, Ministry of Finance
Indicator 10.4
Improved performance in health RBF districts
Average RBF district score for quality of care
Baseline (2014): 30 percent
Target by 2021: 50 percent
Source: MOH checklist report from PBF statistics
Indicator 10.5
Improved performance in schools
Number of schools funded through results-based contracts in target areas
Baseline (2015): 0
Target by 2020: 400
Source: MOE

children.name: Freight Trains
children.para: Improved transport and ICT services. 1)Reduction in the costs of road transport between Douala and NDjamena 2)Increase in rail Freight volumes between Douala and Ngaoundere 3)Further reduction in the average dwell time in Douala port 4)Increased access to broadband internet services. Indicator 7.1: Road transport prices per container between Douala and NDjamena and per ton-km in USD Baseline (2014): 6,000 Target by 2021: 5,600 Source: Multimodal Transport Project Indicator 7.2: Rail Freight volumes transported along the Douala-Ngaoundere corridor by train per year (in million tons/year) Baseline (2014): 1.90 Target by 2021: 2.30 Source: CEMAC Transport and Transit Facilitation Project Indicator 7.3: Transaction dwell time in Douala port in days Baseline (2007): 11 Target by 2019: 6 Source: CEMAC Transport and Transit Facilitation Project Indicator 7.4: Access to broadband Internet services (fixed and mobile) Baseline (2016): 13 percent of population Target by 2022: 40 percent of population Source: ICT Sector Reform Project

children.name: Sustainable Forest Management
children.para: Improved regulatory and institutional framework for key sectors. 1)Establishment of an operational National Electricity Transmission Operator 2)Increased use of the Road Fund 3)Improved transparency in mining sector Management 4)Improved urban Management, planning and support to decentralization 5)Strengthened capacity in REDD+ issues. Indicator 11.1: Energy National Electricity Transmission System Operator fully operational Baseline (2015): Integrated power sector Target by September 2017: Power sector fully unbundled Source: Lom Pangar Hydropower Project FY12; Hydropower Development on the Sanaga River Project Indicator 11.2: Increased use of Road Fund Share of annual Road Fund resources spent on road maintenance Baseline (2015): 55 percent Target by 2019: 70 percent Source: Transport Sector Development Project Indicator 11.3: Improved transparency in mining sector Management Public online access to historic and newly acquired geo-data information Baseline: No (2012) Target by 2018: Yes Source: Mining Sector TA Project Indicator 11.4: Improved urban Management, planning and support to decentralization Local Governments that implement asset Management plans as specified in the city development contracts Baseline: 0 (2017) Target by 2022: 7 Source: Inclusive Cities Project Indicator 11.5: Strengthened capacity in REDD+ issues GOC contribution to joint Congo Basin submission to UNFCCC Baseline: 0 (2014) Target by 2017: Submitted Source: Enhancing Institutional Capacities on REDD+ Issues for Sustainable Forest Management in the Congo Basin Project
